overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> An experiment is performed in which a collision occurs between cart <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and cart <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. Data are collected about each cart before and after a collision takes place. Which data from the table should the student use to verify the conservation of momentum for each trial, and what is a justification for using those data?

choices.label: The initial and final velocity of cart <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and the initial and final velocity of cart <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the speeds should be compared before and after the collision.

The mass of cart <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, the initial velocity of cart <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the final velocity of cart <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the momentum of cart <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> should be determined before and after the collision.

The mass of cart <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, the initial velocity of cart <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the final velocity of cart <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the momentum of cart <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> should be determined before and after the collision.
All data are necessary to verify the conservation of momentum, because all information for each cart should be known.

content.answer: All data are necessary to verify the conservation of momentum, because all information for each cart should be known.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
